column4: Can you recommend a solution for turning on a computer remotely, other than Wake-on-LAN?
Call someone to push the button? :)
excellent, I should have thought of that.
problem is the lag, of course...
APC makes power-strips that have a modem attached and you can dial in to turn on specific outlets [assuming your machine will auto-start when power is applied]
interesting. That's the APC that makes UPSs, isn't it? I'll look it up.
Or Sun Netra's serial console works even when the machine is turned off [as long as power is applied of course]  and you can serial console in and turn them on. :)
I'm sure there are OOB admin cards for servers than you can get that would allow you to do that too. Don't know of any brands though.
it must be cheaper than ca. $200 (which is what a decent mainboard with WOL would cost...)
Ah... I think you're screwed then :)
SOlution: don't turn off the machine. :)
I considered that. Problem is, it's fairly unstable (running experimental VDR software) and I want it to boot on an as-needed basis to have the best chance of recording the shows I want to watch.
I had no idea how cheap Socket A boards have become... I think one of them is going to be the answer.
